text: SOLID principles e Single Responsibility Principle o Ã¤lglass should have only one reason to change, avoid having methods that do different ings o Open/Cglosed Principle o |Itshould be possible to expand the set of operations or fields, but the interface must remain stable for others to use e Liskov Substitution Principle o |Itshould be possible to substitute a parent type with subtype instance e Interface Segregation Principle o Keep in the (super)type only the necessary methods e Dependency Inversion Principle o Types should only depend on more abstract types
